body: Merged manually (see cloudera/kudu#8).  Thanks!

closing this..
the connector can be found in https://github.com/apache/bahir-flink/tree/master/flink-connector-kudu

Thank you for this patch.

The Kudu project doesn't accept GitHub pull requests; we do code review and submission via the gerrit tool. Could you please adapt this PR into a gerrit change? Instructions on how to use gerrit are available [here](https://kudu.apache.org/docs/contributing.html).

Sorry, I have some problems when using gerrit, which I can't fix:
`ssh: connect to host gerrit.cloudera.org port 29418: Connection timed out`
closing this as it's already been merged manually

If the timeout is while fetching the commit hook needed by gerrit, does the following work for you?
```
cd kudu
gitdir=$(git rev-parse --git-dir)
curl -LSsf https://gerrit.cloudera.org/tools/hooks/commit-msg -o ${gitdir}/hooks/commit-msg
chmod +x ${gitdir}/hooks/commit-msg
```

If it's when trying to access gerrit's repo (i.e. git pull or git push), one of us can create the gerrit change on your behalf.
I have a problem with my development computer, so I can't do it. Please fix it in your way.

OK, I made a gerrit change [here](https://gerrit.cloudera.org/c/12237/).

Doesn't look like I have permission to close this pull request yet; I'll work on that.
I can mark as closed. I will also review the patch @adembo created.

Hi Jimmy,

Sorry for the delay in responding to your pull request. The Kudu project doesn't merge new code through PRs; we use the [gerrit](https://www.gerritcodereview.com/) tool to do code review and submission. Could you follow the directions [here](https://kudu.apache.org/docs/contributing.html) to adapt this PR into a gerrit change?

Separately, the spelling of the text in LICENSE.txt should be kept as-is, as that's the original, word-for-word license from SSLeay. You can see another copy of it as part of [the OpenSSL project](https://www.openssl.org/source/license-openssl-ssleay.txt).

Thank you for the pull request.

We don't make code change through GitHub PRs so these automated PRs aren't very useful.

I've gone ahead and disabled the "automated security fixes" feature of the repo.

OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

Hi @sebpop,

Thank you very much for the patch!

The Kudu project doesn't merge new code through GitHub PRs; we use the [gerrit](https://gerrit.cloudera.org/q/status:open%20project:kudu) tool to do code review and submission. BTW, both the Apache Impala and Apache Kudu projects strive to share the common code, so please be aware of the following activity in the related area (it seems you've commented on [IMPALA-11694|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IMPALA-11694], but just in case :) )
* https://gerrit.cloudera.org/#/c/19882/
* https://gerrit.cloudera.org/#/c/19865/

@martongreber To set the access key on a "custom" jenkins instance, you'll need to add it as a secret which can be accessed as an env var. For more details you can check out the [Develocity Maven extension docs](https://docs.gradle.com/develocity/maven-extension/current/#via_environment_variable).

@martongreber - To obtain an access key for Kudu Jenkins, please file a ticket with ASF Infra. They can provision a CI user for your project. This would be preferred over using an account tied to you or a specific ASF committer.

Thank you very much for working on this!

mapreduce has been obsoleted a few years ago and removed from Kudu repo with f8d060bd1d9066b0a6d4afa9bd7eb4d4f082037f.  So, closing this pull request.
Haven't heard from the author for more than one year after request to post the patch using gerrit.  Closing this pull request for now.
